physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a large group of children standing in a courtyard. Sections of two buildings can be seen in the background of the photograph. The children are of varying ages. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of group of children in a courtyard
subject_terms_1: children (people by age group) indigenous people snapshots
